page.title: 05PORTERFIELD PRISON
page.content:
(THIS IS CONTINUED FROM PAGE 4)
ALL HIS MEALS IN HIS CELL. (ONLY REMAND PRISONERS EAT IN A SMALL DINING ROOM). HE GETS LOCKED UP FROM 7A.M. TO 9A.M. WHILE THE OFFICERS HAVE THEIR BREAKFAST. AT 9A.M. HE GOES TO THE WORKSHOP WHERE HE MIGHT MAKE FOOTBALL NETS, ARMY NETS, LOBSTER CREELS OR SEW MAIL BAGS. AT 1P.M. HE GOES TO EXERCISE JOGING ROUND THE YARD. HE WORKS FROM 2P.M. TO 4P.M. WHEN HE HAS A MEAL,AFTER WHICH HE IS LOCKED UP TILL 7P.M. RECREATION FOLLOWS. THERE ARE THREE POOL TABLES,ONE DART BOARD AND ONE PING-PONG BALL TABLE.ON FRIDAY NIGHT, PRISONERS WATCH A VIDEO. AT 9P.M. HE IS LOCKED UP FOR THE NIGHT AND LIGHTS OUT AT 10P.M. THE RUNNING AND MAINTENANCE OF THE WHOLE PRISON IS CARRIED OUT BY STAFF WITH THE CO-OPERATION OF THE PRISONERS.
